verses.text: And the children of Israel again did evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, when Ehud was dead.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan , that reigned in Hazor ; the captain of whose host \add was\add* Sisera , which dwelt in Harosheth of the Gentiles.
And the children of Israel cried unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for he had nine hundred chariots of iron ; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel. \p
¶ And Deborah , a prophetess , the wife of Lapidoth , she judged Israel at that time.
And she dwelt under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah and Beth-el in mount Ephraim : and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.

And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali , and said unto him, Hath not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel commanded , \add saying\add*, Go and draw toward mount Tabor , and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun ?
And I will draw unto thee to the river Kishon Sisera , the captain of Jabin’s army , with his chariots and his multitude ; and I will deliver him into thine hand.
And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me, then I will go : but if thou wilt not go with me, \add then\add* I will not go.

And she said , I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding the journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour ; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose , and went with Barak to Kedesh. \p
¶ And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh ; and he went up with ten thousand men at his feet : and Deborah went up with him.

Now Heber the Kenite , \add which was\add* of the children of Hobab the father in law of Moses , had severed himself from the Kenites , and pitched his tent unto the plain of Zaanaim , which \add is\add* by Kedesh.
And they shewed Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to mount Tabor.

And Sisera gathered together all his chariots , \add even\add* nine hundred chariots of iron , and all the people that \add were\add* with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles unto the river of Kishon.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft together: Heb. by cry, or, proclamation\f*

And Deborah said unto Barak , Up ; for this \add is\add* the day in which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath delivered Sisera into thine hand : is not the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* gone out before thee? So Barak went down from mount Tabor , and ten thousand men after him.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* discomfited Sisera , and all \add his\add* chariots , and all \add his\add* host , with the edge of the sword before Barak ; so that Sisera lighted down off \add his\add* chariot , and fled away on his feet.

But Barak pursued after the chariots , and after the host , unto Harosheth of the Gentiles : and all the host of Sisera fell upon the edge of the sword ; \add and\add* there was not a man left.\f + \fr 4.16 \ft a man: Heb. unto one\f* \p
Howbeit Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite : for \add there was\add* peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite. \p

¶ And Jael went out to meet Sisera , and said unto him, Turn in , my lord , turn in to me; fear not. And when he had turned in unto her into the tent , she covered him with a mantle.\f + \fr 4.18 \ft mantle: or, rug, or, blanket\f*
And he said unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water to drink ; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk , and gave him drink , and covered him.
Again he said unto her, Stand in the door of the tent , and it shall be, when any man doth come and enquire of thee, and say , Is there any man here ? that thou shalt say , No.

Then Jael Heber’s wife took a nail of the tent , and took an hammer in her hand , and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples , and fastened it into the ground : for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.\f + \fr 4.21 \ft and took: Heb. and put\f*

And, behold, as Barak pursued Sisera , Jael came out to meet him, and said unto him, Come , and I will shew thee the man whom thou seekest. And when he came into her \add tent\add*, behold, Sisera lay dead , and the nail \add was\add* in his temples.
So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel.

And the hand of the children of Israel prospered , and prevailed against Jabin the king of Canaan , until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.\f + \fr 4.24 \ft prospered…: Heb. going went and was hard\f*
